compRecruitScreeningAnswers.The reason why you want to come to Japan: I want to come to Japan because Japan is one of the leading countries in AI and I am deeply interested in the field od AI. I have always been fascinated by the amazing work culture of Japan and I myself want to be a part of that work culture.
compRecruitScreeningAnswers.The career plan you want: Currently I am in the 3rd year of my college and will graduate after almost 1.5 years. After that I plan to do a stable job preferably in the field of AI/ML and backend development.
compRecruitScreeningAnswers.In which country do you want to work aft: For me, there is no such boundation. I can work in India, the US and even Japan.
compRecruitScreeningAnswers.Are you likely to be adaptable to other: Although I am quite attached to my Indian roots, I am confident enough that given a sufficient amount of time in a new place, I will be able to adapt to the culture well.
compRecruitScreeningAnswers.Instead of English-speaking countries li: Apart from the amazing work culture and the hard-working people in Japan with whom I want to work, I will get to learn a new language while I work in Japan.
compRecruitScreeningAnswers.What are your expectations from the comp: I want to get a decent package enough to stay comfortably in a foreign country like Japan. Furthermore, I want to work on projects related to my chosen field of interest.
compRecruitScreeningAnswers.What would you like to accomplish during: I want to contribute to cutting-edge AI/ML technologies by applying by technical skills whilst also getting to learn new skills.

compRecruitQuestionnaireAnswers.Your strengths and characteristics: I am a hard-worker. I am good at grasping new concepts. I work good with a team.
compRecruitQuestionnaireAnswers.Weaknesses or areas where they would lik: It takes time for me to acquire new skills. Also, I prefer not to work alone.
compRecruitQuestionnaireAnswers.Steps they are taking or plan to take to: I try to work alone to learn to work alone.
compRecruitQuestionnaireAnswers.Example of a challenge or setback you ha: During a tight project deadline, our team encountered unexpected technical issues that threatened the completion of the entire project.
compRecruitQuestionnaireAnswers.Lessons learned from that experience: We quickly adopted a collaborative problem-solving approach, fostering open communication. We learned the importance of adaptability and contingency planning, ensuring smoother project execution in the future.
compRecruitQuestionnaireAnswers.Do you have any unique background that d: My background in both engineering and graphic design sets me apart, allowing me to bridge the gap between technical and creative aspects in projects.
compRecruitQuestionnaireAnswers.Do you have any specialty?: Specializing in data analytics, I excel in deriving meaningful insights from complex datasets, providing valuable information for strategic decision-making.

projects.title: LLMGuard
projects.description: Developed pipeline for bias/toxicity detection in outputs of large language models and integrated GPT-2, BERT and other language models for testing. Developed user-friendly UI (ReactJS) and backend (Django Rest Framework) for integration of detectors and providing an intuitive platform for using the developed pipeline.

projects.title: Literature Society IITJ Website
projects.description:
A website developed for managing various activities for literature society of IIT Jodhpur. The website contains the following features: 
-User Profile Management (with in site notification service) 
-Library Management System 
-Feature to upload written works to be displayed on website (Reader's Section). 
-Moderator and Admin access profiles to approve books and contents.

projects.title: CloudPhysician's Vital Extraction Challenge
projects.description: Fine-tuned DETR and detectron to for ICU monitor segmentation images of ICU rooms and vital segmentation from ICU monitors. Worked on graph digitisation algorithm to digitize ECG strip

projects.title: Multi Model Data Analysis for Annotation of Human Activities
projects.description: Performed data analysis and outlier detection on a dataset of accelerometer and gyroscope readings. Ideated and executed a pipeline for performing cleaning and detecting the activity type throught the dataset.

projects.title: FaceNet Implementation
projects.description: Implemented FaceNet research paper and Standard Siamese network from scratch using PyTorch. Successfully trained both on CelebA dataset.

projects.title: SHAMIYANA APP
projects.description:
A Food Delivery cum ordering App for Shamiyana Cafe. 
Objectives 
- To make the ordering process hassle-free and time-saving. 
- To manage the Cafe easily by a web portal. 
Deliverables 
- An App for Shamiyana Cafe where customers can orderfood online.

projects.title: RAPID
projects.description: A web app where users can play games like chess with their friends, while having a one to one video call with them to increase the engagement. Uses WebSockets forrealtime communication of gameplay information. Uses WebRTC api forthe video call feature.

projects.title: SMART SENSING MIDDLEWARE
projects.description: A web application to show data collected from smart home devices and display it in the form of graphs for better understanding and use in the analysis.

projects.title: Cloudphysician's Vital Extraction Challenge
projects.description: Extracted the values of vitals from the images of ICU monitors and returned the values in form of a python dictionary. We used object detection to identify the relevant areas from the image and then applied text recognition.

projects.title: Multi Model Data Analysis for Annotation of Human Activities
projects.description: A pipeline which can predict human activities based on continuous analysis of data provided by accelerometer and gyroscope present in a smartwatch.

projects.title: Website for the Literature Society of the college
projects.description: A website comprising of a complete library management system along with a readers' section where users can view uploaded content and choose to upload their content too. These are the two major features among many others.

projects.title: LLMGuard
projects.description: We had to build a user interface for machine learning models that we trained to detect hate profanity, bias etc in the responses generated by large language models. I worked on developing the backend of the system, i.e, on integrating the machine learning models with the user interface using Rest APIs.

The reason why you want to come to Japan: Want to learn from Japanese work culture
compRecruitScreeningAnswers.Steps they are taking or plan to take to: To address these areas, I'm actively participating in relevant workshops and online courses to bolster my skills, and I also make a conscious effort to seek feedback and implement it in my day-to-day tasks.
compRecruitScreeningAnswers.Weaknesses or areas where they would lik: I am always striving for self-improvement and continuously seek opportunities to enhance my communication skills and expand my technical knowledge.
compRecruitScreeningAnswers.Lessons learned from that experience: Consistency is the secret of compound interest, so don't let your hopes to be shattered in a short run , keep going and you will achieve what you desired.
compRecruitScreeningAnswers.Example of a challenge or setback you ha: Beacuse of health reasons, I had a major setback in my preparation for JEE during COVID lockdown. But with determination and support from my teachers and parents , I managed to overcome it and secured a good rank in JEE.
compRecruitScreeningAnswers.Your strengths and characteristics:
My driving factor which keeps me pushing for newer things is my curiosity towards , "How It Works". This has been my idealogy, responsible for my engineering career.
Apart from it , I have a great ability to understand and make others understand complex things in a simpler way.
compRecruitScreeningAnswers.Do you have any unique background that d:
JEE Advanced Rank:590 out of 1,50,000 candidates
JEE mains Rank:438 out of 10,00,000 candidates
NTSE Scholar
KVPY Scholar 2020 and 2021

galkRecruitQuestionnaireAnswers.Instead of English-speaking countries li: I'm interested in working in Japan because I've always felt a strong connection to values like hard work, punctuality, and dedication in my professional life. Japan is renowned for embodying these principles, and I believe working with individuals who share these traits would be an ideal match for someone like me, fostering holistic personal development. Additionally, despite the cultural differences between India and Japan, I'm drawn to the shared values of humility, groundedness, and the expression of respect for others, which motivate me to pursue opportunities in the "Land of the Rising Sun."
galkRecruitQuestionnaireAnswers.What are your expectations from the comp:
I have several expectations from the company, including:

A positive and supportive work culture that fosters creativity and collaboration.

Ample opportunities to express my ideas and contribute to the company's goals.

Access to a wealth of learning experiences and the chance to acquire new skills.

Mentorship from experienced professionals to help me thrive in my role.

An inspiring environment that motivates me to push my limits and excel in my work.

An opportunity to immerse myself in Japanese culture to facilitate a smooth transition into the new work environment.
galkRecruitQuestionnaireAnswers.Do you have any specialty?: Indeed, I do possess a specialty. Beyond my academic pursuits, I have a natural inclination towards curiosity. I consistently find myself deeply interested in a wide array of subjects, driven by a strong desire to comprehend them thoroughly, to delve into the intricacies of "how" and "why," and to apply the knowledge I acquire to further expand my understanding of these topics. This innate curiosity fuels my passion for continuous learning and exploration.
galkRecruitQuestionnaireAnswers.What would you like to accomplish during:
During the internship with the company, my goals include the following:

Exploring new areas and potentially venturing into different fields.

Collaborating with a diverse group of individuals with various talents and a strong desire to learn from one another.

Receiving guidance and mentorship to advance my technical expertise.

Acquiring and enhancing a range of skills to broaden my skillset.

Applying my knowledge and skills to contribute to valuable projects.

Innovating and developing new solutions.

Gaining hands-on experience with various tools and technologies.
galkRecruitQuestionnaireAnswers.What is your Strength and Weakness?:
My strength lies in my ability to distill complex concepts into simpler, more understandable points. I have a knack for making these concepts accessible to others, and my unique perspective often sets my thoughts apart from my peers, adding a distinct dimension to my expression.

However, on the flip side, I consider myself a deliberate learner rather than a fast one. I prefer taking my time to grasp new concepts thoroughly, which enhances my clarity of understanding but may lead to a slightly longer learning curve.
galkRecruitQuestionnaireAnswers.Are you likely to be adaptable to other:
Certainly, I believe I have a natural adaptability to different cultures. I come from a country where diversity thrives, with distinct dialects and cultural variations every 100 kilometers. Despite these differences, we coexist harmoniously and lovingly as a unified whole.

Growing up in such an environment has equipped me with the skills to seamlessly integrate into new cultures. Moreover, the shared values of humility and groundedness between Japan and India act as a bonding agent, helping bridge cultural gaps and fostering a sense of unity and understanding between the two cultures.
galkRecruitQuestionnaireAnswers.What project have you worked on that you:
One project that stands out as a source of great pride for me was a video conferencing project I undertook during a summer break. This project marked a significant milestone in my journey as it introduced me to the intricate world of web development, encompassing both frontend and backend aspects of website creation, in addition to working with APIs. Notably, it kindled my fascination for the networking field, offering insights into the intricate workings of computer connectivity, network formation, and maintenance.

The project involved delving into subtle nuances of networking, particularly through the utilization of webRTC API and the socket.io library. I take immense pride in the fact that this was a personal project that I undertook independently, from conceptualization to execution, and it served as a testament to my capabilities and commitment to advancing my skills in web development and networking.

projects.title: Video Conferencing Project
projects.description: This is a clone of the video conferencing website, Google Meet, which implements many features such as messaging system, file sharing system, screen sharing and recording along with video and audio call.

projects.title: TEDxIITGuwahati Website
projects.description: This Group Project is the website for the main event of the TEDxIITGuwahati which hosted TED talk this year at IIT Guwahati.

projects.title: Alcheringa Pass Portal
projects.description: The Pass Portal is the main website for the distribution of the Passes to the non IITG participants for the Alcheringa, largest cultural fest of North-East India.
